com.threerings.media.sprite

Class ImageSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.threerings.media.AbstractMedia
      • com.threerings.media.sprite.Sprite
        • com.threerings.media.sprite.ImageSprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Pathable, DirectionCodes, Shape
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CharacterSprite, OrientableImageSprite

    public class ImageSprite
extends Sprite
    Extends the sprite class to support rendering the sprite with one or more frames of image animation. Overrides various methods to provide correspondingly desirable functionality, e.g., hitTest(int, int) only reports a hit if the specified point is within a non-transparent pixel for the sprite's current image frame.

      • TIME_SEQUENTIAL

        public static final int TIME_SEQUENTIAL
        Animation mode indicating sequential progressive animation. Frame 0 is guaranteed to be shown first for the full duration, and so on.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageSprite

        public ImageSprite()
        Constructs an image sprite without any associated frames and with an invalid default initial location. The sprite should be populated with a set of frames used to display it via a subsequent call to setFrames(com.threerings.media.util.MultiFrameImage), and its location updated with AbstractMedia.setLocation(int, int).

      • ImageSprite

        public ImageSprite(MultiFrameImage frames)
        Constructs an image sprite.
        Parameters:
        frames - the multi-frame image used to display the sprite.

      • ImageSprite

        public ImageSprite(Mirage image)
        Constructs an image sprite that will display the supplied single image when rendering itself.

    • Method Detail

      • hitTest

        public boolean hitTest(int x,
                       int y)
        Returns true if the sprite's bounds contain the specified point, and if there is a non-transparent pixel in the sprite's image at the specified point, false if not.
        Overrides:
        hitTest in class Sprite

      • setAnimationMode

        public void setAnimationMode(int mode)
        Sets the animation mode for this sprite. The available modes are:
        • TIME_BASED: cues the animation based on a target frame rate (specified via setFrameRate(float)).
        • MOVEMENT_CUED: ticks the animation to the next frame every time the sprite is moved along its path.
        • NO_ANIMATION: disables animation.
        Parameters:
        mode - the desired animation mode.

      • setFrameRate

        public void setFrameRate(float fps)
        Sets the number of frames per second desired for the sprite animation. This is only used when the animation mode is TIME_BASED.
        Parameters:
        fps - the desired frames per second.

      • setMirage

        public void setMirage(Mirage mirage)
        Set the image to be used for this sprite.

      • setFrames

        public void setFrames(MultiFrameImage frames)
        Set the image array used to render the sprite.
        Parameters:
        frames - the sprite images.

      • layout

        public void layout()
        Instructs this sprite to lay out its current frame and any accoutrements.

      • paint

        public void paint(Graphics2D gfx)
        Description copied from class: AbstractMedia
        Called by the appropriate manager to request that the media render itself with the given graphics context. The media may wish to inspect the clipping region that has been set on the graphics context to render itself more efficiently. This method will only be called after it has been established that this media's bounds intersect the clipping region.
        Overrides:
        paint in class Sprite

      • tick

        public void tick(long timestamp)
        Description copied from class: AbstractMedia
        Called periodically by this media's manager to give it a chance to do its thing.
        Overrides:
        tick in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        timestamp - a time stamp associated with this tick. Note: this is not obtained from a call to System.currentTimeMillis() and cannot be compared to timestamps obtained there from.
